metaDescription: Luxury 2-bedroom penthouse in El Verger, Costa Blanca. €423,500. Premium new build with Mediterranean views. Perfect holiday home investment.
heroIntro: Discover your Mediterranean escape in this stunning 2-bedroom penthouse located in the heart of Playa de La Almadraba, El Verger. Priced at €423,500, this property represents exceptional value for a premium-specification holiday home—40% less expensive than comparable properties on Spanish islands. Imagine waking to the sound of waves, spending sun-drenched afternoons on pristine beaches, and enjoying long Mediterranean evenings in your own private sanctuary. This isn't just a property purchase; it's an investment in a lifestyle of perpetual sunshine, authentic Spanish charm, and the freedom to escape whenever you desire. With 80 square meters of thoughtfully designed living space across two bedrooms and two bathrooms, this penthouse offers the perfect balance of comfort and intimacy for discerning holiday seekers who refuse to compromise on quality or location. Whether you're seeking a personal retreat, a rental investment, or both, this El Verger gem delivers on every level.
areaSection: El Verger is a coastal jewel on the Costa Blanca, positioned between the larger towns of Denia and Javea on Alicante's stunning northern coastline. This charming Mediterranean village benefits from its authentic Spanish character while remaining perfectly accessible for international visitors. The area enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine, with temperate winters and warm, dry summers—ideal for year-round beach enjoyment. Playa de La Almadraba, where this property sits, offers a quieter alternative to crowded tourist beaches, providing peaceful swimming and water sports in pristine waters. The surrounding landscape features dramatic coastal cliffs, hidden coves, and the scenic backdrop of the Bernia mountains. Infrastructure is modern and efficient, with excellent road connections to Alicante airport and major towns, while maintaining the relaxed pace that makes this corner of Spain so appealing to those seeking genuine Mediterranean living.
lifestyleSection: Life in El Verger revolves around the simple pleasures that define Mediterranean living. Your days can begin with a morning swim at one of the nearby Blue Flag beaches, followed by a leisurely breakfast at a beachfront café where English is commonly spoken within the established international community. The town boasts excellent local restaurants serving fresh fish and regional cuisine, while weekly markets offer vibrant produce and authentic Spanish products. Shopping for essentials is effortless with Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets minutes away, supplemented by charming local markets. The expat community here is well-established and welcoming, creating a social environment without sacrificing Spanish authenticity. Healthcare access is straightforward with a regional hospital within 30 minutes and private clinics offering English-speaking doctors. Whether you're enjoying tapas with new friends, exploring hidden coastal paths, or simply relaxing on your penthouse balcony with a glass of local wine, El Verger offers the authentic holiday lifestyle that transforms visits into cherished memories.
investmentSection: This penthouse represents a compelling investment opportunity in an increasingly popular Costa Blanca location. El Verger's real estate market is experiencing robust growth at +8% year-on-year, significantly outpacing broader Spanish property trends. Holiday rental potential is substantial—comparable 2-bedroom properties in this location typically command €800 per week, translating to approximately €41,600 annually for 13 weeks of summer bookings alone. Unlike investments in Spanish island markets where comparable properties exceed €7,000/m², this property's €5,294/m² pricing delivers 40% greater value while maintaining identical rental appeal. El Verger's authentic charm and quieter positioning versus overcrowded tourist destinations create sustainable rental demand from quality-conscious travelers. Whether approached as a personal holiday retreat, an income-generating investment, or both, the combination of favorable pricing, growth trajectory, and strong rental fundamentals makes this penthouse a strategically sound acquisition for discerning property investors.
conclusion: This 2-bedroom penthouse in El Verger represents far more than a property transaction—it's an investment in your personal Mediterranean sanctuary. Combining exceptional value at €423,500 with prime beachfront positioning, premium specifications, and strong rental income fundamentals, this property delivers on every criterion discerning holiday homeowners and investors evaluate. Whether you envision leisurely mornings on Playa de La Almadraba, welcoming friends and family to your personal Spanish retreat, or establishing reliable rental income through peak season bookings, this penthouse executes brilliantly across all scenarios. The established expatriate community, modern amenities, healthcare excellence, and authentic village character create an environment where vacation memories transform into lasting lifestyle satisfaction. faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca consistently ranks among Spain's most desirable property markets for international buyers, offering stable price appreciation, strong rental demand, and exceptional lifestyle quality. The region combines authentic Mediterranean character with modern infrastructure, extensive healthcare and education services, and an established expatriate community. Market growth of +8% year-on-year in locations like El Verger demonstrates continued investor confidence in the region's fundamentals.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without citizenship or residency restrictions. EU citizens enjoy identical rights to Spanish nationals, while non-EU citizens can acquire property through standard procedures. You will require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and may work with an English-speaking lawyer familiar with international property transactions. The process is straightforward and well-established, with thousands of international buyers completing purchases annually.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers exceptional value compared to Northern Europe and North America. Monthly living costs for a couple typically range from €1,200–€2,000 depending on lifestyle choices, including housing, utilities, groceries, and dining. Healthcare costs are minimal through Spanish social security systems, while international private insurance remains affordable. Beachfront dining and entertainment are reasonably priced by international standards, making the region ideal for retirees and holiday homeowners seeking cost-effective Mediterranean living.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Property purchase costs in Spain typically include 6-8% transfer tax, notary fees (0.5-1%), and registration costs (0.1%), totaling approximately 7-9% of the purchase price. Additional costs may include real estate agent commissions (3-5%) and legal fees (€600–€1,500). For this €423,500 property, budget approximately €30,000–€38,000 in total acquisition costs. Our team can provide detailed breakdowns and connect you with qualified legal professionals to manage the purchase process transparently.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain mortgages from Spanish and international banks, typically accessing 60-70% loan-to-value financing. Requirements include documentation of income, credit history, and employment verification. Interest rates are competitive with broader European markets. Many international residents successfully obtain mortgages through Spanish banks familiar with cross-border transactions. We recommend consulting with a mortgage broker specializing in international property finance to identify optimal lending options for your circumstances.

faqs.question: What is the typical rental income for holiday homes in El Verger?
faqs.answer: 2-bedroom properties in El Verger typically command €800 per week during peak summer season (June-September), declining to €500–€700 weekly during shoulder months. Annual rental income for 13 weeks of summer bookings approximates €10,400, with additional income potential during Easter, Christmas, and October holidays. Professional property management companies operating in the region typically charge 25-30% commissions while handling reservations, guest communication, and housekeeping. Conservative estimates suggest €35,000–€42,000 in annual gross rental income, providing 8-10% annual yields on property purchase price.

faqs.question: How far is Costa Blanca from the United Kingdom?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca ligger omtrent 1,400 kilometers (870 miles) south of the United Kingdom. Direct flights from major UK airports to Alicante typically require 2-2.5 hours flight time, with numerous daily connections available year-round. Flight costs range from £40–£120 depending on advance booking and airline selection. The accessible location makes Costa Blanca ideal for UK-based holiday homeowners seeking frequent visits without extended travel commitments. Ferry alternatives via Santander or Plymouth also provide options for those preferring vehicle transport.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 300 annual sunshine days, making it among Spain's sunniest regions. Summers (June-September) are warm and dry with temperatures reaching 28–32°C, while winters (December-February) remain mild with temperatures typically 12–18°C. Rainfall is minimal, concentrated primarily in autumn and spring months. This perpetual sunshine environment makes the region ideal for year-round beach activities, outdoor dining, and holiday enjoyment. The consistent weather patterns provide reliable conditions for property rental businesses and personal holiday retreats throughout the year.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca bra for pensjonister?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is exceptionally popular with international retirees, offering affordable living costs, excellent healthcare, abundant sunshine, and a welcoming expatriate community. Many retirees choose to establish permanent residency while others maintain holiday homes for extended seasonal stays. The region provides healthcare quality equivalent to Northern Europe, cultural amenities, and social activities catering to mature international residents. Retired buyers find Costa Blanca combines lifestyle enjoyment with financial practicality, making it an increasingly popular retirement destination for European and international seniors.
